definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: He therefore thought that the use of their negligence, earn ill- gotten gains.
sentences.chinese: 于是他就想到，利用他们的疏忽，赚取不义之财。

sentences.english: Never use the terms “filthy lucre” or “I despise money.”
sentences.chinese: 永远不要使用词语“不义之财”或“我鄙视金钱。”

sentences.english: The bank robbers went to Brazil to live on their ill-gotten gains.
sentences.chinese: 那些银行抢窃者们到巴西去拿不义之财生活。

sentences.english: Treasures gained by wickedness do not profit, but righteousness delivers from death.
sentences.chinese: 不义之财毫无益处，唯有公义能救人脱离死亡。

sentences.english: While millions were fighting and dying, the profiteers were lining their pockets.
sentences.chinese: 数百万人在打仗捐躯，而奸商们却趁机发不义之财。

sentences.english: Tana accused the west of the father is the man stealing other peoples wealth.
sentences.chinese: 塔纳指责西瓦的父亲是偷窃别人的不义之财的人。

sentences.english: He escaped to South America with his ill-gotten gains .
sentences.chinese: 他带着不义之财逃往南美。

sentences.english: He despises ill-gotten wealth, but does not absolutely despise interests.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝不义之财，又不绝对重义轻利。

sentences.english: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house.
sentences.chinese: 贪爱不义之财的祸害自己的家。

definition: the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to be greedy in getting money
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
